result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew L Burks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit For Time Served 5 Days, If Revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cost and Surcharge Paid In Full.  Remaining Cash Bail to be refunded to poster.
AODA Evaluation and follow through with recommendations (Agent to review MS clinical services report.)

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Possess no firearms, ammunition and weapons.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Forfeiture of gun (Bursa Thunder 380 and ammunition).
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  6 Months Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED.
Each year of Probation with the Last 20 hours to be completed by 08-30-2017.

Defendant Andrew L Burks in court with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.  Atty. Masnica requests a new sentencing date. 

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Plea hearing on August 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Fragoso is requesting a new plea date with a separate sentencing date to prepare a sentencing memo.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.
